title: Kim Kardashian goes make-up free for McDonald's run in track pants
text:
Kim is a total vibe (Picture: Getty Images)

Kim Kardashian is a total mood as she went on a McDonald’s run over the weekend.

Make-up free and wearing track pants, the mogul just couldn’t resist the hunger for a delicious soft-serve ice cream as she made the pilgrimage to the golden arches.

While, yes, her track pants are probably Yeezy-banded and worth more than your entire closet, that doesn’t stop the aesthetic, right?

Because it’s a big mood.

The 38-year-old make-up mogul and reality star took a moment off from her legal studies to run out on Friday night for a cheeky treat.

After appointments at the Skims offices in Los Angeles, she shimmied out of her body contouring garments to enjoy a cone, in mismatched grey sweats and grey and black chunky sneakers.

It’s like looking in the mirror at ourselves on a Sunday night.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She kept her hood mostly up for the outing, as she tried to go incognito, the massive swirl of ice cream mesmerising us all as she was captured making her great escape, dessert in hand.

This is amazing (Picture: Splash News)

Well we know what we’re doing tonight (Picture: Splash News)

It comes after the lawyer-in-training was behind another inmate walking free.

Momolu Stewart, who was convicted of murder in 1999 as a teenager, has now had his life sentence reduced from life to time served plus three days, with five years of probation.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The 39-year-old was originally found guilty by a jury in Washington DC, alongside Kareem McCraney, for the murder of Mark Rosebure, 23.

Kim, who is currently studying to become a lawyer as she follows in her father Robert’s footsteps, met with Stewart back in July at the District Of Columbia Correctional Treatment Facility. After meeting one-on-one, she wrote a letter of support for him.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The case is also set to be featured in Kim’s documentary, which will be released in 2020.

It’s not the first time a prisoner Kim has advocated for has been set free, after Paul Algarin, who was formerly convicted on weapons charges, was offered jobs around the world following her help.

Despite only currently being a law student, it seems Kim is already smashing it after she helped free 17 inmates in 90 days earlier this year.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Live life like you’re Kim Kardashian with her soft serve on a McDonald’s run in track pants.
